title: Document CLI chat command usage and features
description:
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** comprehensive documentation for the chat command
**So that** I understand how to use CLI chat mode effectively

**Context:**
With the new consoul chat command, users need documentation covering:
- Basic usage and getting started
- Keyboard shortcuts and navigation
- Slash commands reference
- Tool approval workflow
- Configuration options
- Comparison with TUI mode
- Examples and common workflows

**Technical Notes:**
- docs/user-guide/chat.md - Create new page
- docs/cli-reference/index.md - Update with chat command details
- README.md - Add chat mode mention
- Update quickstart with chat example
- Add to mkdocs.yml navigation

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** user reads docs/user-guide/chat.md
**When** they want to start using chat
**Then** clear examples and instructions are provided

**Given** user wants to know available options
**When** they read CLI reference
**Then** all flags and options are documented with examples

**Given** user wants to know keyboard shortcuts
**When** they read the shortcuts section
**Then** all keys are listed (Ctrl+C, Ctrl+D, arrow keys, etc.)

**Given** user wants to understand slash commands
**When** they read slash commands section
**Then** all commands are documented with usage examples

**Testing Considerations:**
- Verify all examples work as documented
- Test commands on fresh install
- Check links work in rendered docs
- Verify mkdocs renders correctly

**Implementation Hints:**
Create docs/user-guide/chat.md with sections on getting started, keyboard shortcuts, slash commands, tool approval, configuration, and examples. Update CLI reference and README with chat mode information.

Dependencies: SOUL-170 (Main chat implementation)
